[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Token: LockId Collision] At line 128, LockId equals input.VoteId. Can VoteId collision cause lock conflicts in token contract? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Token: Symbol Validation] At line 31, AcceptedCurrency is checked in whitelist but not validated for format. Can invalid symbol cause token contract calls to fail? (Low)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Token: Lock Amount Zero] If amount calculated at lines 94-103 is zero, will token lock at line 124-130 succeed or fail? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Quadratic: TicketCost Validation] At line 102, TicketCost.Mul(currentVotesCount) is calculated without validating TicketCost > 0. Can zero or negative TicketCost break economics? (Critical)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Quadratic: Vote Count Reset] QuadraticVotesCountMap at line 100 increments indefinitely. Should count reset per snapshot or voting item? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Quadratic: Cost Progression] At line 102, cost is linear (TicketCost * count), not quadratic. Is this intended or should it be TicketCost * count^2? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Quadratic: Counter Persistence] QuadraticVotesCountMap at line 100 persists across snapshots. Should it be reset when TakeSnapshot() is called? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Quadratic: Withdrawal Impact] When withdrawing quadratic vote, should QuadraticVotesCountMap be decremented to allow revoting at lower cost? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Quadratic: Amount Display] At line 119, UpdateVotingResult is called with amount (line 102 calc) for quadratic voting but with 1 for vote count. Is Results map storing token amounts or vote counts? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Snapshot: Historical Modification] At line 253, previous snapshot's SnapshotEndTimestamp is modified after creation. Can this affect merkle proofs or historical queries? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Snapshot: Progressive Voting] At lines 269-270, VotersCount and VotesAmount carry over to next snapshot. Are new votes in new snapshot additional or replacement? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Snapshot: Cross-Snapshot Withdrawal] Withdraw() at line 207 uses votingRecord.SnapshotNumber. Can voter withdraw from old snapshot affecting new snapshot's carried-over counts? (High)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Snapshot: Concurrent TakeSnapshot] Can sponsor call TakeSnapshot() multiple times in parallel, causing snapshot number inconsistency? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Snapshot: Hash Collision] At line 368-374, GetVotingResultHash uses VotingItemId and SnapshotNumber. Can same hash occur for different items? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Auth: Sponsor Privilege Abuse] Sponsor has control over Register, TakeSnapshot, AddOption, RemoveOption. Can malicious sponsor manipulate voting unfairly? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Auth: Delegated Voting Trust] At lines 386-388, delegated voting requires sponsor to be sender. Can sponsor vote on behalf of users who never consented? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Auth: Withdrawal Permission] At lines 197-200, withdrawal permission differs by IsLockToken. Can this be exploited to prevent legitimate withdrawals? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Auth: Option Modification] At lines 283, 306, 317, 329, only sponsor can modify options. Can sponsor collude with voters to manipulate outcomes? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Auth: Context.Sender Validation] Throughout contract, Context.Sender is used for authorization. Can sender be spoofed in delegated call scenarios? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Input: Option String Length] At lines 294, 307, 333, option length is checked against 1024. Can exactly 1024-char option cause off-by-one errors? (Low)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Input: Negative Amounts] At line 96, input.Amount is used directly without checking >= 0. Can negative amounts corrupt vote totals? (Critical)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Input: Null Hash Handling] At lines 387-388, null checks for voter and VoteId. Can Hash.Empty or Address.Zero bypass these checks? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Input: Timestamp Validation] At line 361, only checks EndTimestamp > StartTimestamp. Can past timestamps or far-future timestamps cause issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Input: Empty Options Array] At line 49, options are added without checking array is non-empty. Can voting item with zero options be created? (Medium)
